info.title: Payment Processing APIs include send, receive, details, reclaims and remitance informations.

tags.name: cancel
tags.description: REST-based operations to cancel in-flight transfers

tags.name: refund
tags.description: The domain of operations to request the return of previously completed transfers to the sender

post.description: This service can be used by a Participant to send a new Interac e-Transfer to an existing Recipient using an ISO 20022 pacs.008 message format.  This service works as a single step operation (as opposed to the initiate/submit services which require 2 steps).

get.description: This service can be used by Participants to obtain from Interac the list of all received transfers for one of their Customers.  The service can be used in several ways depending on which request filter parameters are specified.  The returned list contains transfers sorted by received date in descending order.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Start date/time in UTC. Required only if participant_reference and payment_schedule_reference are absent.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: End date/time in UTC, Present only if participant_reference and payment_schedule_reference are absent.

parameters.name: participant_reference
parameters.description: payment reference number at Participant FI.

parameters.name: payment_schedule_reference
parameters.description: Schedule reference number associated with the payment, if the payment was created as a result of a payment schedule

parameters.name: exclude_bulk_initiated_payments
parameters.description:
Indicator used to exclude bulk initated transfers.
false - No
true - Yes
By default it would be false, bulk initiated transfers are included in the response.

parameters.name: payment_state
parameters.description:
Transfers to be returned in the response based on the transfer state
ALL - All transfers included (default)
PENDING - Outstanding (transfers not cancelled or completed)
FINALIZED - Finalized ( transfers cancelled or completed)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset is starting point of payments request filter; if offset is not provided it would be defaulted to zero;

parameters.name: max_response_items
parameters.description: Maximum number of response items to be returned. All items are returned if this field is absent.

post.description: This service can be used by a Participant to request specific payment details.

get.description: To obtain a list of all the transfers submitted using the two-way commit option (begin, commit, rollback) for a specific Customer,  the Participant FI can use the GET INTERRUPTED TRANSFERS message. Further, if more details (such as status) are needed for a particular interrupted transfer,  the Participant can use the GET FINANCIAL TRANSACTION message.

This service can be used by a Participant to look up a registered service and to inquire about the transfer options available for a specific Contact/Recipient belonging to a Customer.  It is normally invoked before creating and submitting a transfer to that Contact/Recipient.

-> This service can be used by Participants to obtain from Interac the list of all received transfers for one of their Customers. The service can be used in several ways depending on which request filter parameters are specified. The returned list contains transfers sorted by received date in descending order.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset is starting point of received payment filter; if offset is not provided it would be defaulted to zero;

parameters.name: max_response_items
parameters.description: Maximum number of response items to be returned. All items are returned if this field is absent.

post.summary: Initiate Payment (2-phase send e-Transfer payment in ISO 20022 Message format).
post.description: This service is used by a Participant to set up or to initiate a new e-Transfer. This service does not send the actual transfer. It is only the first step in a 2-step process, and it must be followed either by a Submit Payment call (to actually send the payment) or by a Reverse Payment call (to stop the payment).

put.summary: Submit Payment (2-phase send e-Transfer payment in ISO 20022 Message format).
put.description: This service is used by a Participant to submit a payment that was initiated (set up) using an Initiate Payment service.

delete.summary: Stop Payment ( 2-phase send e-Transfer payment in ISO 20022 Message format).
delete.description: This service is used to stop a payment that was initiated (set up) using an Initiate Payment service.

get.description: This service is used by the Participant to obtain from Interac the status of a particular financial transaction. The financial transaction can be identifies by one and only one of the following, participantTransactionId, or by participantReferenceNumber or by beginTransactionId.

get.summary: Get sent payment by Interac Reference Number
get.description: This service can be used by Participants to obtain from Interac a specific transfer for one of their Customers.

patch.description: This service can be used by a Participant to submit to Interac the authentication information provided by their Recipient Customer for one of their incoming Transfers. It is essentially used to authenticate the Recipient. This operation is required only if the authenticationRequired flag for the incoming Transfer was set to 1 (i.e. required).

post.description:
The sender can use this function to stop an in-flight transfer (i.e. a transfer not yet completed) and ensure
that the funds are transferred back into the sender's account.

post.summary: Begin two-phase cancellation of an in-flight transfer.
post.description: This function is used by the sender to initiate the cancellation of a specific outgoing transfer.

201.description: The transfer was successfully removed from the in-flight queue.

put.description:
This function is used by the sender to indicate that the outgoing transfer can be removed safely from the
in-flight transfer queue.

delete.description:
This function is used by the sender to indicate the funds transfer operation was not successful, and that the
outgoing transfer should resume.

204.description: The cancellation request was itself cancelled.

get.description: For a Customer wishing to view the full status history of a particular outgoing Transfer, the Customer's Participant can use the GET TRANSFER STATUS HISTORY service. The result includes every status the Transfer has passed through, with a date stamp for each status change.

post.description: This service is used to complete an incoming transfer. The request either fails or succeeds and no rollback is possible.

get.description: This service allows a Participant to obtain the details of an incoming Transfer for one of their Recipient Customers.  It is normally invoked by the Participant after the Customer has received the incoming Transfer notice and has given indication that he/she wants to proceed with accepting it.

post.description: This function is used to initiate the completion of an incoming transfer.

put.description: This function is used to commit the complete transfer begin, once the funds are successfully transferred by the Participant.

delete.description: If the funds transfer operation is not successful, this function is used to rollback the complete transfer begin.

post.summary: Returns a payment to the sender
post.description: This function is used to refund payments which were submitted or paid previously.

post.summary: Initiate a payment return to the sender
post.description:
This `InitiatePaymentReturn` function is used to start the process of refunding payments which were submitted or paid previously.
The actual payment will not be sent at this stage.

201.description: The system is ready to return the payment to the sender.

put.summary: Commit a payment return to the sender
put.description:
This function is used by a participant to submit/commit a payment return that was previously initiated using
the `InitiatePaymentReturn` message.

delete.summary: Rollback a payment return to the sender
delete.description:
This function is used to revoke/cancel a payment return that was previously initiated using
the `InitiatePaymentReturn` message.

200.description: The pending refund was revoked successfully.

post.description: The service also offers a way for the Sender to reissue the notification for a Transfer.  For example in case this reissue is needed because incorrect or invalid Contact information, the Sender Participant's FI can also make use of the UPDATE CONTACT message to update the Contact information.

patch.description: If a Customer (Sender) needs to update the security question and answer for one of his/her outgoing Transfers,  the Sender's Participant FI can use the UPDATE TRANSFER AUTHENTICATION message to submit to the e-Transfer system the updated information.

get.description: This service can be used by Participants to retrieve from Interac the remittance data associated with a specific payment or payment request for one of their Customers.

post.description: This service can be used by Participants to send remittance data associated with a specific payment to Interac or payment request for one of their Customers.

get.description: This service can be used by Participants to retrieve from Interac the remittance location data associated with a specific payment or payment request.

post.description: This service can be used by Participants to send remittance location data associated with a specific payment to Interac.

x-et-page-next-offset.description: Pagination parameter - the offset of the 1st record in the next reqeusted record set  against the total records in backend

x-et-page-size-limit.description: Pagination parameter - the number of record on each returned page

x-et-page-total-records.description: Pagination parameter - the total number of record in the backend system

x-et-rate-limit-ceiling.description: The rate limit ceiling for that given endpoint in the given window.

x-et-rate-limit-remaining.description: The number of requests left for the current window. Since the eTransfer is calculating the rate limit based on GMT in HOUR window, the timezones that have 30-minute shift should realize the remaining count is based on the clock in the hourly-shift zones.

x-et-rate-limit-window.description: The rate limit gauging and resetting window. To simplify the complexity of the impact of timezone on the rate limiting, eTransfer will use GMT for rate limiting window. MINUTE is the default setting unless specified otherwise.

x-et-response-code.description: A numeric response code specifying the outcome of the message. A successful call will return a response code of 0, along with any additional response data.

AccountAliasHandle.name: deposit_handle
AccountAliasHandle.description:
If serviceType is EMAIL - Customer's email address used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is UUID - Customer's UUID used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is PHONE - Customer's phone number is used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT - Recipient's/Contact's account

AccountAliasType.name: deposit_type
AccountAliasType.description:
Flag indicating the type of the Account Alias registration
EMAIL - means Email based account alias registration
UUID - means UUID based account alias registration. Multiple types of unique identifiers are supported.
PHONE - means Phone based account alias registrations.
ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT - Account based Direct Deposit.

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: Standard HTTP Header used to implement OAuth 2.0 bearer scheme.

CancelPaymentTransactionToken.name: x-cancel-txn-token
CancelPaymentTransactionToken.description: The one-time token received from the previous `CancelTransferBegin` response.

ClearingSystemReference.description: The Interac-generated transfer reference number, also known as the clearing system reference number.
ClearingSystemReference.name: id

ClearingSystemReferenceNumber.description: The Interac-generated Clearing System Reference Number.
ClearingSystemReferenceNumber.name: id

IndirectConnectorId.name: x-et-indirect-connector-id
IndirectConnectorId.description: Financial Institution/Debtor Agent Identifier (not Direct Connector) as defined in e-Transfer system.

ParticipantCancelPaymentTransactionToken.name: x-participant-cancel-txn-token
ParticipantCancelPaymentTransactionToken.description: The participant txn-id provided in received from the previous `CancelTransferBegin` request.

ParticipantId.name: x-et-participant-id
ParticipantId.description: Direct Participant Identifier as defined in e-Transfer system. Participant must ensure conformity to the following pattern before transmitting this data - CA000xxx where xxx is the Financial Institution Identifier as defined by the Canadian Payment Association. If customer's FI connects indirectly through a Participant, the participant-id field identifies the direct connector.

ParticipantReference.description: TransactionIdentification reference of the payment or payment request. ( participant ReferenceNumber ), Present if ClrSysRef is missing.
ParticipantReference.name: participant_reference

ParticipantTransactionId.description: TransactionIdentification reference of the payment or payment request. ( participant transaction id ), Present if ClrSysRef is missing.
ParticipantTransactionId.name: participant_transaction_id

ParticipantUserId.description: Present for all API calls initiated on behalf of a customer. Customer ID provided as defined in the Participant system and Customer must be registered in the e-Transfer system.
ParticipantUserId.name: x-et-participant-user-id

PaymentReference.name: id
PaymentReference.description: The payment reference or ID at Interac.

PaymentTransactionToken.name: x-payment-transaction-token
PaymentTransactionToken.description: The one-time token received from the previous Payment initiate (sent / receive/ cancel ) response.

ProductCode.name: product_code
ProductCode.description:
Identifies an Interac e-Transfer product by code. The valid code values are -
DOMESTIC - e-Transfer domestic

ReceivePaymentTransactionToken.name: x-receive-payment-transaction-token
ReceivePaymentTransactionToken.description: Interac transaction token from the previous `ReceivePaymentBegin` response.

RefundTransactionToken.description: The one-time token received from the previous `InitiatePaymentReturn` response.
RefundTransactionToken.name: x-refund-txn-token

RemittanceIdentification.description: Remittance identification reference. Conditional usage; either the clearingSystemReference or the remittanceIdentification is required, but not both.
RemittanceIdentification.name: id

RequestId.name: x-et-request-id
RequestId.description: Unique ID generated for each request used for message tracking purposes. In case of a request retry use the same ID as in the original message.

RetryIndicator.name: x-et-retry-indicator
RetryIndicator.description: Flag indicating if the operation is a retry of a previous request (true/false). Always to be specified for requests where it is important to avoid the cases where the same operation is accidentally performed twice.

Signature.name: x-et-api-signature
Signature.description: JWS detached signature of the payload (body only), required for all API calls.

SignatureType.name: x-et-api-signature-type
SignatureType.description: The type of the JWT. Required. Allowed values are "PAYLOAD_DIGEST_SHA256"

TransactionTime.name: x-et-transaction-time
TransactionTime.description: A particular point in the progression of time defined and expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

429-too-many-requests.description: Too many requests; blocked due to rate limiting.

503-service-unavailable.description: Service Unavailable - The server cannot handle the request for a service due to temporary maintenance.

AccountAliasHandle.description:
If serviceType is EMAIL - Customer's email address used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is UUID - Customer's UUID used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is PHONE - Customer's phone number is used to uniquely identify the account alias registration across the system.
If serviceType is ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT - Recipient's/Contact's account

AccountAliasRegistrationDetails.description: Direct Deposit Data required to deposit a transfer directly into Recipient's/Payee's account. If present the Contact is eligible to receive Direct Deposit e-Transfer domestic transfers.

account_alias_handle.description: UUID associated with the Payee/Recipient. The UUID must exist in the system and it uniquely identifies the Payee's/Recipient's direct deposit registration.

sender_account_identifier.description: Sender's/Customer's account identifier in Payee's/Recipient's system.

AccountAliasType.description:
Flag indicating the type of the Account Alias registration
EMAIL - means Email based account alias registration
UUID - means UUID based account alias registration. Multiple types of unique identifiers are supported.
PHONE - means Phone based account alias registrations.
ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT - Account based Direct Deposit.

proprietary.description: Proprietary scheme name used in the identification of the account. Accepted values are 'ALIAS_ACCT_NO' - Identification scheme used by Interac to identify the Account alias registration number of an e-Transfer customer 'BANK_ACCT_NO' - Unique and unambiguous assignment made by a specific bank or similar financial institution to identify a relationship as defined between the bank and its client

amount.description: Transaction amount, with the specified currency.

AuthenticatePayment.description: Transfer authentication method to be used unless the transfer is created with another type of transfer authentication

security_answer.description: 'Answer to the security question (as provided by the customer) with leading and trailing whitespace trimmed, uppercase, postfixed with hashSalt if present, hashed using the algorithm identified by hashType and then Base64 encoded. ISO-8859-1encoding to be used when the hash is generated. '

AuthenticationType.description:
'Flag indicating the type of authentication required to complete the Transfer.
CONTACT_LEVEL - Security question and answer defined at contact level.
PAYMENT_LEVEL - Security question and answer defined at payment level.
NOT_REQUIRED - No authentication.
'

type.description: Bank Account Identifier (CANADIAN - Canadian bank account)

account.description: Bank account number. Canadian bank account format is aaa-bbbbb-cccccccccccccccccccc where 'aaa' is the Financial Institution Identifier 'bbbbb' is the Transit Number 'cccccccc...' is the Account Number.

BeginTransactionId.description: If available this must contain the Interac-generated begin transaction Id (i.e. clrSysBgnTxId) that was provided in the Initiate Payment response message.

BusinessName.description: Business name. This is required for type 1 (small business) or 2 (corporation)

CancelPaymentTransactionToken.description: A one-time token generated specifically to commit or rollback a specific cancel transaction.

ChannelIndicator.description:
Method Sender accessed the servicedescription: Identifies the channel that the customer is using when making the request if the request is initiated by the customer. For requests initiated by an e- Transfer system or a participants system component it identifies the system that makes the request. Integer, values
ONLINE = Customer online initiated transaction
MOBILE = Customer mobile initiated transaction
PARTICIPANT_BULK_PAYMENT = Participant payment system initiated Bulk file transaction (*)
PARTICIPANT_ETRANSFER_SYSTEM = Participant payment system initiated transaction
PARTICIPANT_FRAUD_SYSTEM = Participant fraud detection system initiated transaction
ETRANSFER_SYSTEM = e-Transfer system initiated transaction (*)
ETRANSFER_FRAUD = e-Transfer fraud detection system initiated transaction (*)
EXTERNAL_APPS = External API initiated transaction (*)
INTERAC_SDK = Interac Proximity SDK initiated transaction
(*) - values not accepted through Participant initiated requests

ChargeBearerType1Code.description: This identifies which party(ies) will pay changer due for processing this transaction. Value is set to "SLEV", which means Following Service Level"

member_identification.description: Identification of the Instructed/Instructing/Debtor/Creditor Agent.  The value 'NOTPROVIDED' in the MemberIdentification element can be used when this information is not provided or is not available.

ClearingSystemReference.description: The Interac-generated payment or request for payment reference numbers, also known as the clearing system reference in ISO 20022.

alias_name.description: Recipient/Contact Name/Alias, as known by the customer. Recipient/Contact Name/Alias has to be unique for the customer unless the Recipient/Contact is a one time contact.

ContactType.description:
'Flag indicating whether the Contact is a business or not. Required if legal name is required. (e.g. for for e-Transfer International Remittance)
retail
small business
corporation'

CountryCode.description: Only ISO 3166 Alpha-2 codes are allowed.

related_remittance_information.description: Elements in this data block can be used to specify details related to the handling of the remittance information such as remittance location and/or  the unique identification of the remittance information if it was sent separately from the payment instruction.

CustomDate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in XML Schema Part 2 Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004 which is aligned with ISO 8601.

CustomDateTime.description: A particular point in the progression of time defined and expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

fi_account_id.description: Unique FI Identifier for the customer account (tokenized account).

registration_name.description: Customer's primary registration name or alias

CustomerType.description:
Identifies the customer type based on the following numeric codes -
retail
small business
corporation

code.description: Error list for all the APIs, please refer to the example for API-specific error codes.

ExternalPaymentTransactionStatus1Code.description: This indicates the transaction processing ISO status. Acceptable codes ACTC - AcceptedTechnicalValidation PDNG - Pending ACSP - Accepted Settlement In progress - indicates transaction was processed successfully, RJCT - indicates transaction processing has been cancelled

credit_transfer_transaction_information.description: Elements used to provide information about payments.

transaction_information_and_status.description: Data block that contains information concerning the original transaction, to which the response/status report message refers Usage - only one occurrence of this data block is allowed in this response message.

transaction_information.description: Data block that contains information concerning the original transaction, to which the response/status report message refers Usage - only one occurrence of this data block is allowed in this response message.

score.description: Numeric value between 0 and 999 qualifying Fraud Detection System assessment of fraud risk.

reason.description: Fraud Reason from Fraud Detection System

action.description: Description of action to be performed to mitigate fraud.  (Allow Transfer, Block Transfer, Delay Transfer, User Input Ruired, No Check Performed)

identification.description:
if scheme name is ALIAS_ACCT_NO then this element must contain the Account Alias Reference Number (i.e. Autodeposit reference number) generated by Interac if scheme name is BANK_ACCT_NO then this element must contain the actual bank account number. Valid format aaa-bbbbb-cccccccccccccccccccccccc where
  aaa is the Institution Id (fixed length 3 digits)
  bbbbb is the Transit Number (fixed length 5 digits)
  cccccccccccccccccccccccc is the bank account number (up to max 24 digits)
participant user ID at their financial institution (creditor / debtor/ initiating party ).

GetPaymentStatusRequest.description: Wrapper element that encompasses the whole structure of the request message.

initiating_party_id.description: The id of the initiating party for this payment. Conditional - this element is present only if it was present in the original payment submission and also if this response is provided to the debtor/sender side of the payment (NOT the creditor/recipient side).

initiating_party_name.description: The name of the initiating party for this payment. Present if it was provided in the original payment submission.

message_identification.description: The reference number for this request message. It must be unique (within each FI / Interac system) for every request.
The reference number for this request message. It must be unique (within each FI / Interac system) for every request.

HashType.description: Algorithm used to hash the security answers, passwords examples - SHA2.

ISODate.description: Requested execution date and time for payment request. A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in XML Schema Part 2 Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004 which is aligned with ISO 8601.

ISODateTime.description: "A particular point in the progression of time defined and expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (YYYY-MM- DDThh:mm:ss.sss).  These representations are defined in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004 which is aligned with ISO 8601. "

originated_participant_id.description: ID of participant where the transfer has originated

authentication_required.description:
Transfer authentication required or Not
false - Not Required
true - Required

additional_remittance_info.description:
This element indicates if there is additional remittance information available for this transfer, as follows:
  NOT_PROVIDED - indicates that there is no additional remittance information
available for this transaction other than the senderMemo (unstructured remittance)
  ADVICE_DETAILS - indicates that there is additional structured remittance
information available for this transaction in the form or remittance advice
  LOCATION_DETAILS - indicates that there is additional structured remittance
information available for this transaction in the form or remittance location

fi_account_id.description: Unique FI Identifier for the customer account (tokenized account).

begin_transaction_id.description: Interac Transaction Id returned in a Transfer Begin response

participant_transaction_id.description: Unique Participant Transaction ID for tracking and recovery purposes sent in a Transfer Begin request

Language.description: Recipient's Language Preference as defined by Sender

proprietary.description: REGULAR_PAYMENT                  - Regular "Send-Money" payment </br> FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT     - Fulfill Money Request payment </br> ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT            - Auto-Deposit payment </br> REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT - Real-time Fulfill Money Request payment </br> REALTIME_ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT   - Real-time Auto-Deposit payment </br> ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT_PAYMENT          - Account-Deposit payment </br> REALTIME_ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT_PAYMENT - Real-time Account-Deposit payment </br>

NotificationActive.description:
'false - Notifications will NOT be sent
true -Notifications will be sent'

NotificationPreference.description: List of customer's notifications. Not required for e-Transfer US Remittance recipient only customers. Sender's method to notify the recipient. At least one notification has to be defined and active for the contact to be eligible to receive e-Transfer domestic or e-Transfer US Remittance products. If the directDepositData field is present then the notificationPreference at contact level cannot be defined.

NotificationStatus.description:
Notification Status shows the state of notification sent to the recipient/contact. It is returned if the transfer had a notification sent to the recipient/contact to complete the transfer (regular domestic eTransfer).
SENT = Sent
PENDING = Pending
SEND_FAILURE = Send Failure
DELIVERY_FAILURE = Bounced back

request_for_payment_reference.description: Interac Money Request Reference Number to fulfill. Required if transferType is FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT or REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT.

PaymentAuthentication.description: Transfer authentication method to be used unless the transfer is created with another type of transfer authentication

security_question.description: Question text. Required if authenticationType is PAYMENT_LEVEL

security_answer.description: 'Answer to the security question (as provided by the customer) with leading and trailing whitespace trimmed, uppercase, postfixed with hashSalt if present, hashed using the algorithm identified by hashType and then Base64 encoded. ISO-8859-1encoding to be used when the hash is generated. Required if authenticationType is 0.'

instruction_identification.description:
Reference identification as assigned by the instructing party. Usage -
 if the credit transfer is used to fulfill a request for payment (i.e.
if PmtTpInf.LclInstrm.Prtry is FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT or REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT ) then this element is mandatory and must be populated as follows;
 if the request for payment was originally submitted to Interac via a
pain.13 then this element must match the Interac generated reference identification of the request for payment (i.e. clearingSystemReference element from the request body of ISO 20022 - Get Incoming Request for Payment)
 if the request for payment was submitted via a custom non-ISO Money Request
then this element must match the Interac generated reference identification of the request for payment (i.e. requestReferenceNumber)
 if the credit transfer is not used to fulfill a request for payment then
this element is optional

end_to_end_identification.description:
Reference identification as assigned by the customer/debtor. This remains unchanged in the whole end to end flow between the end customers, Usage; if the credit transfer is used to fulfill a request for payment (i.e. if PmtTpInf.LclInstrm.Prtry is FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT or REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT) then,
    if the request for payment was submitted via a pain.13 then this element
must match the EndToEndId reference identification from that pain.013 request for payment
    if the request for payment was submitted via a custom non-ISO Money
Request then this element should be set to 'NOTPROVIDED' if the credit transfer is not used to fulfill a request for payment then,

    if a reference is provided by the Debtor then this element should
contain that value
    if a reference is not provided by the Debtor then this element should
be set to 'NOTPROVIDED'

transaction_identification.description: Transaction identification set by the first instructing agent (typically the Debtor Agent). This remains unchanged in the end to end flow between various agents, Usage; Reference identification as assigned by Debtor FI. This element is mandatory and must be unique for that FI

account_alias_reference.description: Account alias Registration reference number generated by interac, for using at payment initiation

sender_account_identifier_required.description:
Flag indicating if Sender/Customer has to provide an account identifier
false - Not Required
true - Required'

sender_account_identifier_format.description: This element is used to specify the accepted format of the sender account identifier.

sender_account_identifier_description.description: Provide a brief description about the meaning, purpose or location (on the bill) of the sender/subscriber account.

additional_information.description: Further details on the return reason. Conditional Usage,  If ReturnReasonInformation.Code is FOCR (meaning FollowCancellationRequest) then this element must contain the Cancellation Identification from the camt.056 payment cancellation request message. Otherwise this element can contain the additional information for the return reason in a free text format (up to a total of 420 characters), as needed.

PaymentReturnStatus.description:
Interac defined payment status
INITIATED
DIRECT_DEPOSIT_PENDING
DIRECT_DEPOSIT_FAILED
COMPLETED

transaction_information.description: Data block that contains information concerning to payment refunds

PaymentState.description:
Transfers to be returned in the response based on the transfer state
ALL - All transfers included (default)
PENDING - Outstanding (transfers not cancelled or completed)
FINALIZED - Finalized ( transfers cancelled or completed)

PaymentStatus.description:
Interac defined payment status
INITIATED
AVAILABLE
AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE
AUTHENTICATION_SUCCESSFUL
DECLINED
EXPIRED
DIRECT_DEPOSIT_PENDING
DIRECT_DEPOSIT_FAILED
CANCELLED
COMPLETED

original_instruction_identification.description: InstructionIdentification (if available) for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers.

original_end_to_end_identification.description: EndToEndIdentification for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers.

original_transaction_identification.description: TransactionIdentification for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers.

status_reason_information.description: Wrapper element for data block that contains the Interac-defined response code for this message.  Usage - only one occurrence of this data block is allowed in this response message.

clearing_system_reference.description: Interac-generated transfer reference number. Present if the request was processed successfully and the transaction was found.

original_instruction_identification.description: This element must contain the InstrId of the original pacs.008 credit transfer message that is being returned.  Conditional - this value must be provided if it was provided in the original pacs.008 credit transfer message.

original_end_to_end_identification.description: This element must contain the EndToEndId of the original pacs.008 credit transfer message that is being returned.

original_transaction_identification.description: This element must contain the TxId of the original pacs.008 credit transfer message that is being returned.

original_clearing_system_reference.description: This element must contain the ClrSysRef of the original pacs.008 credit transfer message that is being returned.

return_reason_information.description: Provides detailed information on the return reason.

original_instruction_identification.description: InstructionIdentification (if available) for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers.

original_end_to_end_identification.description: EndToEndIdentification for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers.

original_transaction_identification.description: TransactionIdentification for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers. Conditional - either the OriginalTransactionIdentification or the ClearingSystemReference must be provided, but not both

clearing_system_reference.description: ClearingSystemReference (if available) for the original transaction, to which the status request message refers Conditional - either the OriginalTransactionIdentification or the ClearingSystemReference must be provided, but not both

participant_transaction_id.description: Unique Participant Transaction ID for tracking and recovery purposes sent in a Transfer Begin request

begin_transaction_id.description: Interac Transaction Id returned in a Transfer Begin response

request_for_payment_reference.description: Interac Request Reference Number to fulfill. Present if transferType is FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT or REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT.

PaymentType.description: REGULAR_PAYMENT                  - Regular "Send-Money" payment </br> FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT     - Fulfill Money Request payment </br> ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT            - Auto-Deposit payment </br> REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT - Real-time Fulfill Money Request payment </br> REALTIME_ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT   - Real-time Auto-Deposit payment </br> ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT_PAYMENT          - Account-Deposit payment </br> REALTIME_ACCOUNT_DEPOSIT_PAYMENT - Real-time Account-Deposit payment </br>

ProductCode.description:
Identifies an Interac e-Transfer product by code. The valid code values are -
DOMESTIC - e-Transfer domestic

ProxyAccountIdentification1.description: The elements in this data block can be used to specify the handle type and the handle value that were used during the account alias registration. Conditional, If PaymentTypeInformation.LocalInstrument.Proprietary is ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT or REALTIME_ACCOUNT_ALIAS_PAYMENT , then this block is mandatory. In all other cases this block is not required

proprietary.description: Proprietary proxy handle type used in the identification of the creditor account. The following values are currently supported and accepted - EMAIL, UUID or PHONE

recipient_memo.description: Message for SenderNote - If a Recipient enters a memo, it appears on the 'Complete Transfer' email to the Sender.

participant_reference.description: Participant Transaction Reference Number associated with CompleteTransfer transaction.

request_for_payment_reference.description: Interac Money Request Reference Number to fulfill. Required if transferType is FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT or REALTIME_FULFILL_REQUEST_FOR_PAYMENT.

additional_remittance_info.description: This element indicates if there is additional remittance information available for this transfer, as follows, NOT_PROVIDED - indicates that there is no additional remittance information available for this transaction other than the senderMemo (unstructured remittance) ADVICE_DETAILS - indicates that there is additional structured remittance information available for this transaction in the form or remittance advice LOCATION_DETAILS - indicates that there is additional structured remittance information available for this transaction in the form or remittance location

RefundTransactionToken.description: A one-time token generated specifically to commit or rollback a specific refund transaction.

remittance_information.description: Remittance information data block.  Usage -Notwithstanding the ISO 20022 multiplicity for this element only one single occurrence of this data block is allowed.

adjustment_amount_and_reason.description: Wrapper element for detailed information on the adjusted amount and reason of the adjustment.

RemittanceIdentification.description: Remittance identification reference at participant systems.

unstructured.description: Remittance information in an unstructured form. Up to 3 elements allowed for a total of 420 characters.

structured.description: Remittance information in a structured form. Up to 5 block allowed.

remittance_identification.description: Unique identification, assigned by the originator, to unambiguously identify the remittance information within the message.

unstructured.description: Remittance information in an unstructured form. Up to 3 elements allowed for a total of 420 characters.

structured.description: Remittance information in a structured form. Up to 1 block allowed.

remittance_identification.description: Unique identification, assigned by the originator, to unambiguously identify the remittance information within the message.

remittance_location_details.description: Elements used to provide information on the location and/or delivery of the remittance information.

remittance_identification.description: Unique identification, assigned by the originator, to unambiguously identify the remittance information within the message.

remittance_location_details.description: Set of elements used to provide information on the location and/or delivery of the remittance information.

remittance_location.description: Elements used to provide information on the location and/or delivery of the remittance information.

RemittanceLocationMethod2Code.description: Method used to deliver the remittance advice information. Restriction - only value URID is accepted.

RetailName.description: Retail name. This is required for type 0 (retail)

handle.description: The handle of the notification registration at the participant.

ScheduleReference.description: The Interac-generated schedule reference number, also known as the clearing system reference.

fi_account_id.description: Unique FI Identifier for the customer account (tokenized account).

ServiceType.description:
Flag indicating the type of the Account Alias registration
EMAIL - means Email based account alias registration
UUID - means UUID based account alias registration. Multiple types of unique identifiers are supported.
PHONE - means Phone based account alias registrations

SignatureType.description: The type of the JWT. Required. Allowed values are "PAYLOAD_DIGEST_SHA256"

participant_reference.description: Participant Transaction Reference Number. This field only contains a value if a financial transaction has taken place, i.e. Send Transfer, Cancel Transfer or Complete Transfer.

referred_document_information.description: Provides detailed information on the cancellation status reason.

additional_remittance_information.description: This element is used to provide additional information, in free text form. (e.g. invoice description. etc.).

SupplementaryInfo.description: Data required for Fraud or Compliance reasons

customer_ip_address.description: IP Address used by the Customer

customer_card_number.description: Provide if present, Primary Account Number (PAN) of the Debit card associated with account from which funds will be transferred.

customer_device_finger_print.description: Unique identifier of the Customer's device used to initiate the financial transaction

customer_authentication_method.description: Customer's authentication method used to sign in to participant systems.

TransactionId.description: TransactionIdentification reference of the payment. ( participantReferenceNumber )

TransactionIdentifier.description: Unique Participant Transaction ID or Participant Reference for tracking and recovery purposes

instruction_identification.description: The InstructionIdentification reference of the transaction to which this remittance refers.

end_to_end_identification.description: The EndToEndIdentification reference of the transaction to which this remittance refers.

transaction_identification.description: The TransactionIdentification reference of the transaction to which this remittance refers.

TransactionStatus.description:
Financial Transaction Status.
SEND_PAYMENT_BEGIN - Send Transfer Begin
SEND_PAYMENT_COMMIT - Send Transfer Commit
SEND_PAYMENT_ROLLBACK - Send Transfer Rollback
CANCEL_PAYMENT_BEGIN - Cancel Transfer Begin
CANCEL_PAYMENT_COMMIT -Cancel Transfer Commit
CANCEL_PAYMENT_ROLLBACK -Cancel Transfer Rollback
COMPLETE_PAYMENT_BEGIN -Complete Transfer Begin
COMPLETE_PAYMENT_COMMIT -Complete Transfer Commit
COMPLETE_PAYMENT_ROLLBACK -Complete Transfer Rollback

TransactionTime.description: A particular point in the progression of time defined and expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssssZ).

UpdatePaymentAuthentication.description: Transfer authentication method to be used unless the transfer is created with another type of transfer authentication

security_question.description: Question text. Required if authenticationType is PAYMENT_LEVEL

security_answer.description: 'Answer to the security question (as provided by the customer) with leading and trailing whitespace trimmed, uppercase, postfixed with hashSalt if present, hashed using the algorithm identified by hashType and then Base64 encoded. ISO-8859-1encoding to be used when the hash is generated. Required if authenticationType is 0.'

ViewIncomingPaymentAuthentication.description: Transfer authentication method to be used unless the transfer is created with another type of transfer authentication

security_question.description: Question text. This will only be present if the authenticationRequired field indicates that payment authentication is required (authenticationRequired field is true).

ViewPaymentAuthentication.description: Transfer authentication method to be used unless the transfer is created with another type of transfer authentication

authentication_required.description:
Transfer authentication required or Not
false - Not Required
true - Required

security_question.description: Question text. Required if authenticationType is PAYMENT_LEVEL
